page.title: 02Nuthall:about the village
page.content: Nuthall is a quiet and peaceful place . It was a small village but it has grown and new houses have been built, the Larkfields and Horsendale Estates. The{A610}road splits Nuthall into two halves and joins the nearby{M1 {MOTORWAY}at junction 26. The motorway goes over part of the village on a flyover. There are 2 churches in the village Nuthall Methodist Church and Saint Patrick's Church, and there are three schools, Larkfields Infant, Larkfields Junior, and Horsendale Primary. There are a few shops and two Pubs. Close to the village is a coal mine,{BABBINGTON {COLLIERY.}Most of the land round Nuthall is farmland, and just outside the village is a small lake called Temple Lake. Nottingham is the nearest city.
